climbs.name: What We Do in the Shadows

content.description: Farthest left bolt line on front face of Lower Replica. Might be easier than 5.9, might be harder. I'll update later.
content.location: When the approach trail hits the wall, it's a bit to the left.

content.description: Start to the right of The Bowl of Heaven and climb up through sustained difficulty to access a crack. Rest up and fight the pump all the way to the chains. Don't fall into orbit at the top. ** bolts

Quality Climbing on an off-vertical face. This route has a great range of holds form cracks jugs, crimps, pockets, and slopers. Start on the left side of the crag on a left rising crack, follow 6 bolts to a chain anchor.
content.location: The View Top Smokehouse (above the Lower Replica)

content.description: Bring your technique and steel finger tips.  Hard pulls after the first bolt with intensive footwork.  Atypical Wolverine friction.  Needs  grade confirmation.
content.location: East-facing behind the Lower Replica Wall.  In the upper portion of the pinner chute.  It is best approached from the top of the Lower Replica.  Stays in the shade for the the majority of the morning and all afternoon.

content.description: Start on the left side of the aesthetic blue and yellow streak and climb through fun but puzzling crimps and underclings to a  chain anchor directly below the large boulder atop the cliff. Stick clip the first bolt and giddy up! 4 bolts
Start 10' up from Herbert's Route and climb through fun seams, flakes, and underclings to two bolts with carabiners. Small runout in the middle. **bolts
content.protection:
Quickdraws

Anchor is two bolts with carabiners. Could use some chains

content.description: Nice looking features off the ground lead to some moderate tricks.  A tough crux with largish moves on decent holds guards the top.  Good variety of movement throughout.   Shares anchor with "Tenacious".  Morning and afternoon shade.
content.protection: 6 bolts to two bolt top anchor.

content.description: A good warm-up for the other two routes on this wall.  Fun climbing through the first roof leads to a second roof and the  crux.  Continue to the anchors on a variety of excellent holds.
content.protection: 7 bolts with a two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: East-facing in the pinner gully behind the Lower Replica.  Starts just downhill and left of "Tenacious".  Rappel.

content.description: Start 25' uphill of the large orange patch of rock that is in the middle of the wall. Climb up smooth yellow and blue streaked rock with seams to gain the darker stone above. ** bolts

Great rock and beautiful gold streaks give away this fun classic. Start and on a nice flat landing 3/4 of the way up the Lower Replica and climb a short left trending crack to gain the first bolts, then follow awesome holds and thoughtful sequences to a chain anchor at the top of the cliff.

Moderate climbing leads to a good rest, then break onto the face on crimps. A short crux allows you to gain a seam leading up and right to the last bolt. Feels like the bolting is trying to force your right, however the path of least resistance is a little more to the left but still within reach of the bolt line. A good route none the less.
content.location: Starts off the flat landing just right from Hate Street Dialogue.

content.description: The obvious and beautiful line to the top of the Upper Replica. Until recently this route required a few pieces of gear but is now fully bolted. Great climbing leads to a tricky section at just under half height then easier climbing to the last bolt. A classic Wolverine tricky and techy crux guards the anchors. Probably closer to 12c if you’re short. This route definitely has it’s fair share of barnacles but it will gain a star with more traffic.
As strange as it sounds. Shag your way to the back of the bus! 4 bolts

Bolted in the rain, cleaned, and climbed in 3 hours! 3 boulder problems separated by clipping holds. Belay on a small grassy ledge  under the tiny cliff at top right of the Upper Replica. The crux is between the 3rd and 4th bolt while you're still relatively close to the ground... get an attentive belayer and crush it! 4 bolts

It's the line of bolts that is right where the approach trail meets the wall. Follows a left leaning crack up a ways, then shoots up the face to the top. This route comes very close to the end of a 60M rope, so make sure to knot your ends.
